titleStmt.title: Mäḥalǝy zä-Sälomon ʾƎbrayǝsṭ, Songs of Salomon (“Hebrew version”) / Miscellaneous prayers / Dawit “Psalter”

publicationStmt.publisher: Die Schriftkultur des christlichen Äthiopiens: Eine multimediale Forschungsumgebung / beta maṣāḥǝft

availability.licence: This file is licensed under the Creative Commons Attribution-ShareAlike 4.0.

msItem.rubric:
Nomina sacra (including name of God in Text VI-1); title of Text I; initial line of Texts I, III-V; two initial lines of Text II; titles and numbers of the Pss., Canticles and Songs; initial lines of Pss., Canticles and Songs; title and two adjacent lines of the incipit of the daily readings of Text VI-4; title of Texts VI-5 and VI-6; name, number and traditional interpretation of the Hebrew letters in Ps. 118; refrains of Pss. 117, 135 and Canticle 10; words ይሴብሕዎ in Ps. 148 and ሰብሕዎ in Ps. 150; a few single words in Texts VI-4, VI-5, VI-6; doxology after each 10 Pss.; initial line of the colophon; elements of the punctuation signs and text dividers; Ethiopic numerals or their elements.
Three groups of adjacent lines on the incipit page of Texts VI-1, VI-2, VI-3, VI-4; two groups of adjacent lines of the first Ps. from the group of 10 Pss.; two groups of adjacent lines of the the incipit of the daily readings of Text VI-4 and of the incipit of Texts VI-5 and VI-6.

msItem.colophon: left;">Fol. 176rb: ተጽሕፈ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መጽሐፍ፡ በ፲፡ ወ፱፻፤ ዓመተ፡ ምሕረት፤ በዘመነ፤ ዮሐንስ፡ ወንጌላዊ፠ እንዘ፡ ዓበቅቴ ፳፰፣ ወመጥቅዕ፤ ፪፤ ውእቱ፡፦ በ፲፡ ወ፱፡ ዓመተ፡ መንግሥቱ፡ ለምኒልክ፡ ንጉሠ፡ ነገሥት፡ ዘኢትዮጵያ፡፦ ለዘአጽሐፎ፤ ደጃዝማች፡ ወሊ፡ ዘወረባቦ፠ ወለጸሐፊሁ፤ ቀኝ፡ ጌታ፡ መኮነን፡ ዘመካነ፡ ሰማዕት፤ ገላውዲዎስ፤ ኅቡረ፡ ይምሐሮሙ፤ እግዚአብሔር፡ በመንግሥተ፡ ሰማያት፠ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፠ አሜን፤ ለይኩን፠According to the colophnon the Ms. was written in 1900 year of mercy, in the year of John the Evangelist (= 1908 A.D). It mentions the commissioner däǧğazmač Wäle of Wärräbabbo (Wällo), the scribe qäññ geta Mäkonnän and the place of the latter's affiliation, Mäkanä Sämaʿt Gälawdewos (Näḉḉ Śar, Wällo).

layout.ab: Texts: I-V, VI-1, VI-2, VI-3: all data for fol. 9r.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.
Texts: VI-4, VI-5, VI-6: all data for fol. 161r.
The upper line is written above the ruling.
The bottom line is written above the ruling.

decoDesc.decoNote: Elaborate ornamental bands separate from each other: a group of 10 Pss., Mäḥalǝyä näbiyat, Mäḥalǝyä mäḥalǝy and Wǝddase Maryam. At the top of some of them, there is a miniature illustrating one of the Pss. from the group, most often the first one. On the subsequent folio, a relevant verse from the psalm is written on a yellow background within a red frame.

Fol. 8r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces, and floral motifs. At the top a floral motif between two crosses interlaced with floral motifs.

Fol. 14v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on fol. 8r). At the top, illustration of Ps. 11:2: two hypocrite men talking to each other. They exchange a warm handshake with their right hands, while one of the men points an accusatory finger to the other.
Fol. 15r: legends written on a yellow background within a red frame: ከንቶ፡ ይትናገሩ፡ ፩ ምስለ፡ ካልዑ (Ps. 11: 2) “They speak vanity every one with his neighbour”.
In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”.

Fol. 21v: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, rosy, orange, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on fol. 8r). At the top, illustration of Ps. 22:18: four men casting lots. The band is protected by a textile curtain.

Fol. 22r: legend written on a yellow background within a red frame: ወተካፈሉ፡ አልባስየ፡ ለርእሶሙ፦ ወተዓፀው፡ ዲበ፡ ዓራዝየ፦ ፬፡ ሐራ፡ ሰገራት፦ (Ps. 22:“They part my garments among them, and cast lots for my clothing”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”.

Fol. 28v: legend written on a yellow background within a red frame: ፈረሰኒ፡ ሐሰት፡ ኢያድኅን፦ ወኢያመስጥ፡ በብዝኃ፡ ጽንዑ፦ (Ps. 33: “A horse is a vain thing for safety: neither shall he deliver any by his great strength”. In Amharic: ይህ፡ ነው “This is it”.

Fol. 29r: elaborate coloured (red, yellow, violet, rosy, orange, green and blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs (similar to the band on fol. 8r). At the top, illustration of Ps. 33:17: a man fallen from a fleeing horse. The band is protected by a textile curtain.

Fol. 39v: elaborate coloured (violet, orange, green and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, a hart (a deer) giving birth and crying from pain; on both her sides are brooks. The hart is mentioned in Ps. 42: 1. The band is protected by a textile curtain.
Fol. 40r: legend written on a yellow background within a red frame, in Amharic: ኃየል፡ ማለት፡ ዋልያ፡ ናት፡፦ የዋልያ፡ ምጽ፡ ይህ፡ ነው፡፦ “Ḫayäl means a deer. Deer’s birth pangs are these”.

Fol. 47v: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, most probably flowering olive trees (illustration of Ps. 52:8): “But I am like a green olive tree in the house of God: I trust in the mercy of God forever and ever”.

Fol. 54r: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, floral motifs and two crosses.

Fol. 64r: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs. At the top, floral motifs and one cross.

Fol. 76r: elaborate coloured (violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue and red) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top.

Fol. 85r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue, blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. The band is protected by a textile curtain.

Fol. 91r: elaborate coloured (light violet, yellow, orange, green, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top.

Fol. 104r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. The band is protected by a textile curtain.

Fol. 117r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top.

Fol. 120r: elaborate coloured (light violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, also at the top. The band is protected by a textile curtain.

Fol. 127r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, blue, light blue, light brown) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs, at the top floral motifs and a cross.

Fol. 135r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, rosy, yellow, orange, green, light blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs; at the top floral motifs.

Fol. 150r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, red, yellow, green, light blue, blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up and two pointed down; interlaces and floral motifs; at the top two flowers and two birds.

Fol. 159r: elaborate coloured (dark violet, red, yellow, green, light blue, blue) ornamental band with two lateral pendants pointed up, two pointed down and one extended pendant in the middle pointed down; interlaces, floral and anthropomorfic motifs; at the top flower motifs.
Fol. 176r: coloured (red, green, violet, yellow) band; interlaces.

item.q: Fol. 176v: ዝ፡ ዳዊት፡ ዘራስ፡ ሚካኤል፡ ዘወሀቦ፡ ለደብረ፡ ዳሞ፡ ከመ፡ ይኩኖ፡ መድኃኒተ፡ ነፍሱ፡ ዘሰረቆ፡ ወዘፈሐቆ፡ ውጉዘ፡ ለይኩን፡ በሥልጣነ፡ ጴጥሮስ፡ ወጳውሎስ፦

list.item: - The title of the Ms. ዳዊት and the internal number of the monastic library (352) are written on fol. 1r. - The midpoint of the the “Psalms of David” (in Ps. 76) is marked on fol. 70r. as a stamp-like design with a cross in the centre and inscription: መንፈቅ ለዳዊት “Half of Dawit”. - Stamp-like design with an inscription after Ps. 90 (91), መዝሙር ፺ “Psalm 90”: fol. 84v. - Stamp with an inscription, ማኅተም ዘ፳ ራስ ሚካኤል ርእሰ መኳንንት (cf. GueCopMen vol. 1, p.318): fols. 148v, 157v. - Inscription in Gǝʿǝz and Amharic in a light red frame, እም አሌፍ እስከ፡ ታው ፳፪ ነው: fol. 115r. - The scribe reduced the size of his handwriting to accommodate the end of the line: 2v, 3r, 28v, 29r, 34r, 39v. - Part of the line is taken up: fols. 3r, 9v. - Part of the line is taken down: fols. 11r, 154v. - Part of the text is illegible due to smeared ink: fol. 88v. - Omitted letters, words and passages are written interlineally and in the margins, in the main hand: e.g., fols. 3v, 19v, 20v, 30r, 38r, 56v, 69r, 78r, 89r, 94r, 98v, 101v, 110r, 111r, 114r, 122v, 151v, 153r, 154r, 155r, 156r, 169ra, 171ra, 172ra. - Erasures marked with a few red and black lines: fols. 33r, 35v, 39r, 48v, 94r, 109v, 112v, 154r, 156v, 169rb. - Erasures: fol. 47v. - Leaves facing the miniatures and harägs are dyed yellow: fols. 15r, 64r,76r, 159r.

binding.decoNote: Two wooden boards covered with dark grey tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.
Two chains of the endband stitches at the spine cover.

origin.origDate: According to the colophon, the Ms. was completed in 1900 year of mercy (= 1908 A.D.), in the 19th year of reign of King Mǝnilǝk II (r. 1889-1913).

projectDesc.p: Encoded according to TEI P5 Guidelines.

person.persName: According to Additio 2, the Ms. was donated by ras Mikaʾel (Mikaʾel ʿAli ?, b. ca. 1847/50, d. 1918).

revisionDesc.change: transformed from mycore to TEI P5
